Physical Oceanographer

I am a Postdoctoral Research Associate at Princeton University, working with scientists from the Ocean and Ice-Sheet Processes Group at the Geophysical Fluid Dynamics Laboratory (GFDL).

My research is primarly focused on understanding processes related to ice/ocean interactions around Antarctica and their role in regulating the melting of ice shelves and the formation and export of bottom water. To do so, I employ numerical simulations and compare them against observations and analytical theories. I am an active developer of GFDL's ocean model (MOM6).
